metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6.pdf

content: 前言 各位同学，你们好！欢迎大家学习本套英语教材！ 2000 年，外语教学与研究出版社与麦克米伦出版（中国）有限公司依据国家《义务教育英语课程标准（实验稿）》共同组织开发了本套教材；作为我国第一套中小学“一条龙”英语教材，本套教材已出版使用十余年。 2011 年，基于新颁布的国家《义务教育英语课程标准（ 2011 年版）》，我们对教材进行了认真修订。 在修订后的小学教材中，我们为同学们保留了大家熟悉并喜爱的四个小伙伴 — 中国学生大明和玲玲、英国学生 Sam 和 Amy，还增加了其他一些人物和小动物。他们会带领大家在一系列有趣的故事、对话、游戏、活动和歌曲中学习英语。 修订后的教材每册包括10个学习模块（ Module ）、一个复习模块 （ Review Module ）、四个单词表、一个补充阅读（ Reading for Pleasure ） 版块以及一个综合运用实践项目（ Project ）。每个学习模块分两个单元 （ Unit ），一般情况下，第一单元呈现本模块所要学习的语言内容，第二单元提供若干任务型（ Task-based ）活动，包括一首歌曲、歌谣或韵句。学习模块的课文中呈现了一些语法内容，但不要求老师做理论的讲解，更不要求大家孤立地、脱离语境地掌握，只希望大家初步学会在恰当的语境中运用包含这些语法的句子。这一原则也希望老师在教学过程中以及家长在辅导孩子学习的时候注意。复习模块对前面 10 个模块所学的内容进行综合和融合性复习，使大家的语言知识和相应的语言技能得到进一步的巩固与提高。教材有四个单词表，包括：分模块按出现顺序收录的单词，按字母顺序收录的全书单词，歌曲、歌谣或韵句中出现的单词以及人名、地名。在歌曲、歌谣或韵句中出现的新词，只要求理解，不要求学会运用。补充阅读为大家选用了篇幅短小、内容丰富、形式多样的材料。教材最后设计了一个综合运用实践项目，供同学们根据兴趣自由选择使用。 本套教材同时还配有对应的网络教材，可供同学们在线学习使用。 同学们，希望大家积极尝试，大胆实践，主动学做教材中的英语活动， 努力学唱英语歌曲、歌谣和韵句。相信你们会在参与活动、完成任务的过程中体会到学习英语的乐趣，实现英语的灵活运用和自由交际。

content:
2 1. Listen and chant. How long is the Great Wall? 1 t i n U This is the Great Wall. It's very beautiful. It's long and old. And we love it all. 2. Listen, read and act out. Tell me about the Great Wall, Daming. I want to go there. OK. When you visit me in China, we'll go there. It's near my home. Simon: Daming: Daming is visiting the US. He's in New York with his cousin Simon. 
3 1 t i n U Can we walk along all of the Great Wall? No, we can't walk along all of it. It's too long! Simon: Daming: How long is the Great Wall? It's more than forty thousand li long. Forty thousand li ? Yes. That's more than twenty thousand kilometres! Wow! That's really long! How old is it? It's more than two thousand years old! Oh, that's very old. Can you tell me more about the Great Wall? All right. Simon: Daming: Simon: Daming: Simon: Daming: Simon: Daming:

content:
A: How long is the Great Wall? B: It's more than forty thousand li long. A: How old is it? B: It's more than two thousand years old. How long How old How long is the river? How old is the school? It's... It's... the street 6 kilometres the school 50 years the museum 200 years 3,000 kilometres the river 4 3. Listen and say. 4. Practise. 1 t i n U 
5 Simon, look at this building. It's so high! It's the Empire State Building. It's an office building. Can you tell me more about it? All right. It's more than eighty years old. And it's more than four hundred metres high! Wow, that's really high! Yes. Do you want to climb the stairs to the top? Well... Daming: Simon: Daming: Simon: Daming: Simon: Daming: It's more than four hundred metres high! 1. Look, listen and say. 2. Listen and read. 2 t i n U How old is it? It's eight hundred years old. It's my secret. Oh, that's really tall! How tall is the tree? It's thirty metres tall.

content:
6 2 t i n U 3. Listen, point and say. 4. Listen and say. Then sing. THE GREAT WALL OF CHINA The Great Wall of China is very, very long, The people who built it were very, very strong, very, very long, very, very long. The very, very strong, very, very strong. The Great Wall of China is very, very long. people who built it were very, very strong. Thousands of people built it. 
7 5. Guess and say. Is it in our city? Yes, it is. It's about two hundred years old. How old is it? Guess the famous place. 2 t i n U 6. Write and say. Write about your favourite place and talk about it. Yes, it is. Is it the museum? A lot of old things. This park is my favourite place. It is very big. It is about 250 years old. There is a big lake and... This park is my favourite place. It is very big… What can you see there?

content: 8 1 t i n U 1. Look, listen and say. 2. Listen and read. There's a Chinatown in New York. Oh, that's good. Are there any Chinatowns in China? Oh, all towns in China are Chinatowns! Daming: Simon: Daming: Simon: Daming: I'm going to send an email to Mum. I went to Chinatown in New York yesterday. 9 1 t i n U Dear Mum, I went to Chinatown in New York yesterday. I had a big surprise. There were Chinese people everywhere. There were lots and lots of Chinese shops and restaurants. The people spoke Chinese and English. We ate in a Chinese restaurant. The food was different from the Chinese food in China. Then we saw a lion dance in the street. Simon really liked it. He wants to visit China and learn Chinese. He really wants to go to the Great Wall. Love, Daming Chinatown, New York SUBJECT: Mum@nse.cn TO:

content:
10 1 t i n U 3. Listen and say. 4. Practise. I went to Chinatown in New York yesterday. We saw a lion dance in the street. Where did you go last Sunday? What did you see? Where did you go last Sunday? I went to... What did you eat? 
11 I went to a library yesterday. 1. Look, listen and say. 2 t i n U 2. Listen and read. Yesterday, I went to Chinatown. I saw a lion dance there. Look at this photo. You can see it now. Dear Max, We went to the Ming Tombs yesterday. It was exciting! There were lots of stone animals and a big red gate. Did you know they found clothes and money in the tombs... Xiaoqiang Dear Baobao, I went to a library yesterday. It is very big. It has books, CDs and computers. My favourites are books about the US and Canada… Dear Julie, I wrote a story in English class yesterday. My teacher liked it very much! I want to write a book when I am big. I want to visit many countries and write about them… James Ruby

The farmer said to Simple Simon, "Show me first your money!" Simple Simon said to the farmer, "I haven't got any!" What did Xiaoqiang do yesterday? What did James do yesterday? What did Ruby do yesterday? 2 t i n U 1 2 3 
13 5. Guess and say. 6. Think and write. Did you see a friend? Did you do sport? Did you go swimming? Yes, I did. No, I didn't. Yes, I did. What did you do at the weekend? What did you do yesterday? Write an email to your friend. Dear James, I went to a fruit farm yesterday... 2 t i n U

content: 14 1. Look, listen and say. 2. Listen, read and act out. Have you got any stamps from China? 1 t i n U What are you doing, Simon? I'm putting my new stamps into my stamp book. These are stamps from Canada. And these are stamps from the UK. And these ones are very, very old. They're from the US. Daming: Simon: I've got some food from China. Have you got any fish from China? Sorry, I haven't. But I love Chinese fish. 15 1 t i n U Do you collect stamps? No, I don't. But it's a good idea! Here are some stamps from the US and Canada for you. Thank you. You can make a stamp book with them. Great! Simon: Daming: Simon: Daming: Simon: Daming: Have you got any stamps from China? No, I haven't. You always send me emails. You don't send me letters, so I haven't got any Chinese stamps! I will send you lots of Chinese stamps. Thank you. Daming: Simon: Daming: Simon:

16 3. Listen and say. 4. Practise. 1 t i n U A: What are you doing? B: I'm putting my new stamps into my stamp book. A: Have you got any stamps from China? B: No, I haven't. bananas orange juice apples football toy car jacket doll Have you got a knife and fork? No, I haven't. knife and fork kite 
17 Collecting stamps is my hobby. 1. Look, listen and say. 2 t i n U 2. Listen and read. Collecting stamps is my hobby. This is my favourite Chinese stamp. It's a picture of Hainan Island, my favourite place in China. We can see the Five-Finger Mountain and a coconut tree. I love it. It's a picture of the sun. It's a picture of the moon. Oh, it's a picture of my friend from the moon!

content: 18 2 t i n U 3. Read and write. 4. Listen and say. Then chant. You cannot feel it, not at all! So what is it that I need? It's the air around us all. What do I need? What do I need? I need something very special indeed. You cannot see it, not at all! These stamps are from Canada. 19 birds cat computer kite fish bike toy ship dolls football toy plane books pencils stamps 2 t i n U 6. Write and talk. 5. Do and say. A: Have you got a/any...? B: Yes, I have. / No, I haven't. Have you? Collecting toy cars is my hobby. These toy cars are from Canada… Write about your hobby and talk about it. toy cars TV 1 2 3 4 5 6

content:
20 Thanksgiving is very important in the US. 1 t i n U 2. Listen, read and act out. 1. Look, listen and say. Simon, which festival in the US is your favourite? My favourite festival is Thanksgiving. This festival is very important to us in the US. Daming: Simon: National Day is his favourite day. Halloween is her favourite day. Thanksgiving is their favourite day. Children's Day is our favourite day. 
21 1 t i n U I wrote a poem about Thanksgiving. Do you want to hear it? Yes, please. Thanksgiving is nearly here. Thanksgiving comes every year. There is one thing I should say. Thanksgiving is my favourite day! Oh, your poem is amazing! Simon: Daming: Simon: Daming: What do you do on Thanksgiving? We always have a big, special dinner. We say "thank you" for our food, family and friends. We have a lot of fun. Daming: Simon:

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6.pdf

content:
22 1 t i n U 3. Listen and say. 4. Practise. A: What do you do on Thanksgiving? B: We always have a big, special dinner. We say "thank you" for our food, family and friends. Which festival in China is your favourite? My favourite festival is... When is it? What do you do? Talk about festivals. What do you eat? 
23 Can you tell me about Christmas? 1. Look, listen and say. 2. Listen and read. 2 t i n U Can you tell me about Christmas? Sure. It's a very important festival in many countries. It is on the 25th of December. We put Christmas trees in our homes. There are lights in the streets and the shops. We give presents and send cards. We love this festival! Lili: Sam: At the Spring Festival, we eat lots of food. Oh, I love Chinese food. Can we have the Spring Festival now? Ha ha... But it's autumn now.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6.pdf

content: 24 America, America, there are lots and lots of things to see. It's a very big country, from New York to Tennessee. You can climb a high mountain. You can swim in a lake. You can have Thanksgiving and eat lots and lots of cakes. The flag's got three colours. It is red and blue and white. It hangs outside the White House all day and all night. America, A- merica, there are lots and lots of things to see. It's a very big country, from New York to Tennessee. 2 t i n U 3. Write and say. 4. Listen and say. Then sing. Christmas is a very important festival. We give presents. AMERICA, AMERICA

Write about your favourite festival and talk about it. Talk about festivals. The Dragon Boat Festival is a very important festival for Chinese people. On this day, we ... 
26 Can I write to her? 1 t i n U There's a panda in the zoo now. Can he speak English? Maybe. His teacher speaks English. 1. Look, listen and say. 2. Listen, read and act out. Hi, Laura. This is Daming. He's from China. You're from China. Fantastic! Pleased to meet you. Pleased to meet you, too. Simon: Laura: Daming:

27 1 t i n U I've got a friend in China. Her name's Lingling. She can speak some English. She wants an American pen friend. Can I write to her? Of course. You can write to her in English. Look, this is her photo. Oh, she's pretty! Daming: Laura: Daming: Laura: Do you live here now? Or are you visiting? I'm visiting Simon. He's my cousin. I really want a Chinese pen friend. I want to know more about China. Laura: Daming: Laura: 
28 3. Listen and say. 4. Practise. A: Can I write to her? B: Of course. You can write to her in English. She can speak some English. Make friends. the US the UK Canada China Pleased to meet you, too. Pleased to meet you. Can I write to you? I'm from China. Where are you from, Peter? Of course. You can be my Chinese pen friend. I'm from the US. 1 t i n U Hi, Maomao. This is my new friend, Peter.

metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6.pdf

content: 29 2 t i n U 1. Look, listen and say. 2. Listen and read. I want a Chinese pen friend. Pen Friends Hi, I'm Carol. I'm from the US. I can speak some Chinese. I want a Chinese pen friend. Hello, I'm Tingting. I'm Chinese. I'm learning English. I want a pen friend from the UK . We can write in English. Hi, I'm Brian. I come from London. I can't speak Chinese. But I love China. I want new friends from China. Do you want to be my pen friend? I want a pen friend. We can write in English and Chinese. I want a pen friend, too. We can write in French. Tom, do you want a pen friend? No. He wants a phone friend. Ha ha...

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6.pdf

content:
30 3. Write and say. 4. Listen and say. Then sing. 2 t i n U WHERE DO YOU COME FROM? Where do you come from? Your face is new. I come from America and I'm pleased to meet you. Are you from around here? Where are you from? No, I'm not from around here. I'm from Canada. Are you from America? We can't tell from your face. No, we are from England and we love this place. Name I'm from… I can / I can't… I want… Carol Tingting Brian 
31 5. Guess and say. She can play football. She can speak English. 6. Write and say. Choose a pen friend from Activity 2 and write a letter to him/her. 2 t i n U Is it Fangfang? Dear Brian, My name is... I'm from China. I can speak some English. I like... Can you be my pen friend? Best, ... Yes, you are right.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6.pdf

content: 32 1. Look, listen and say. 2. Listen and read. 1 t i n U No, I haven't. No, I haven't. What book have you got? I've got a book about the world. Have you got a book about the US? Look, Amy! A letter from the US. No, it isn't. Is it from Daming? Have you got a book about China? I've got some Chinese chopsticks. 33 1 t i n U Dear Lingling, My name is Laura. I met Daming here in New York. He showed me your photo. Can you be my pen friend? I've got long, yellow hair and blue eyes. I like Chinese food and I've got some Chinese chopsticks. But it is very difficult for me to use them. My brother has got a Chinese kite. It is a very big bird. He often flies it in the park. I'm from New York. It's a very big city. Have you got a book about the US ? Please write back and I will answer your questions about the US. Best, Laura

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）六年级上册_4436b7e6

content:
34 3. Listen and say. 4. Practise. 1 t i n U I've got some Chinese chopsticks. My brother has got a Chinese kite. Have you got a book about the US? What have you got in your room? I've got a desk and a chair. I've got a computer. What have you got in your room? 
35 I haven't got a book about the US. 2 t i n U 1. Look, listen and say. 2. Listen and read. Dear Laura, Thank you for your letter. I'm happy to be your pen friend. I haven't got a book about the US . But I have got some photos of New York. Daming sent them to me. Miss Lin, my Art teacher, helped me make a poster of New York with those photos. My school starts at eight o'clock. It finishes at half past three. What time does your school start and finish? Your friend, Lingling I've got a kite from China. I've got some stamps from China. And Bob has got some food from China!

My school starts at eight o’clock. It finishes at four... Letter or email, card or phone. We can talk together, and we're not alone. 
37 2 t i n U 5. Guess and say. 6. Do and say. These books are for our class. We've got four books about the US. We've got five books about science... He's got short, black hair. At the Class Book Corner He's got long legs. And he plays basketball well. Is it Yao Ming? Yes, you are right.

content: 38 Pandas love bamboo. 1 t i n U 1. Look, listen and say. What are you watching, Daming? I'm watching a new DVD about animals. Simon gave it to me. What does it say about my favourite animal? Pandas? Yes. Pandas love bamboo. They eat for twelve hours a day! I love bamboo, too. Grandma: Daming: Grandma: Daming: Grandma: Daming: Grandma: 2. Listen, read and act out. Do snakes love music? Well, I don't know. Oh, my CD! Does your dog love music? 39 1 t i n U Wow! Look at this picture! The snake can use its body to dance. Do snakes love music? No, they don't. They're almost deaf! They can't hear the music. It says the snake thinks the flute is dangerous, so it gets frightened! Daming: Grandma: Daming: Grandma: Daming: Grandma: This is a fantastic DVD! Yes, it's fantastic! What a great present from Simon!

41 2 t i n U 2. Listen and read. A child sleeps for ten hours a night. 1. Look, listen and say. A child sleeps for ten hours a night. A baby sleeps for sixteen hours a day. A fox sleeps in the day and doesn't sleep at night. Sh! Ah! Help! Sh! The tiger is sleeping. H o w m a n y h o u r s d o y o u s l e e p a n i g h t ? Roar...

Then chant. 18 hours 16 hours 4 hours 10 hours This snake sleeps for eighteen hours a day . How many hours do they sleep a day?

Snakes can hear. 4. ...

content: 53 2 t i n U I want to go to Shanghai. 1. Look, listen and say. 2. Listen and read. There are lots of beautiful places to go in China. I want to go to Shanghai. Shanghai is very big and very famous. Kunming is a beautiful place. It's in the south of China, and it's got a beautiful lake. And there are lots of mountains and lakes in Guilin. Do you want to visit the Changjiang River? Do you want to visit the Huangshan Mountain? Oh, it does. It's flying to China now. I think we should go to all these places. That's a good idea.

When you want to ride on a bus, bus, bus, come with us, us, us. Do you want to drink some juice? Yes, I do. Do you want to visit the zoo, zoo, zoo? Yes, we want to visit the zoo, zoo, zoo. When you want to visit the zoo, zoo, zoo, can we come too, too, too?

content:
76 The Leaf Neighbour: Man from Chu: Neighbour: Man from Chu: Neighbour: Hi! What are you doing? I'm reading a book. It is about an insect called "mantis". I know about the mantis. The mantis eats small insects! Yes, it does. But how does it catch the small insects, do you know? No, I don't. This poor man is from Chu. He is reading a book. A neighbour is walking by. 
77 Man from Chu: Neighbour: Man from Chu: Neighbour: Man from Chu: Neighbour: Let me tell you. The book says there's a special kind of leaf. If the mantis holds the leaf in front of its body, it becomes invisible! The insects can't see it! That's really interesting. I'm going to try it. Really? Of course. I'm going to find the right leaf! Good luck! Bye! 
78 At Home Man from Chu: Wife: Man from Chu: Wife: Can you see me? Yes, I can. Can you see me now? Yes, I can. 79 Man from Chu: Wife: Can you see me now? What? No, I can't see you now. 100 Leaves Later...

content:
79 Man from Chu: Wife: Can you see me now? What? No, I can't see you now. 100 Leaves Later... 
80 Don't take my chicken! You're stealing my rice! But you can't see me! I'm invisible! Of course we can see you, you silly, bad man! Man: Woman: Man from Chu: All: In the Market insect 昆虫 invisible 看不见的 mantis 螳螂 silly 愚蠢的 steal  偷 Word List 
81 The Different Duck A duck is sitting on five eggs. The eggs break and five baby ducks come out. The mother duck looks at her babies. She has four beautiful baby ducks. But one is different. It is big and grey. Its legs are very long. The mother duck doesn't like this baby duck. "Go away," she says to the different duck. "You are not my baby." The different duck says goodbye and goes away. It is sad. 
82 Then it sees a mother pig with her baby pigs. "Are you my mother?" it asks. "No," says the mother pig. "I'm not your mother. Go away."

content:
82 Then it sees a mother pig with her baby pigs. "Are you my mother?" it asks. "No," says the mother pig. "I'm not your mother. Go away." 
83 So the different duck goes away. Soon it sees a fox. "Am I your baby?" the different duck asks the fox. "No, you're not my baby," says the fox. "But I like you. I will eat you for dinner." The different duck runs away. It is very sad. It wants its mother. 
84 Then it hears a voice. "You are very beautiful. I am your mother." The different duck looks up. It is a big, white bird. It has got a long neck. "I am a swan," says the white bird. "And you are a baby swan. You see, here are your brothers and sisters." "So, I'm not a different duck. I'm a swan!" says the baby swan. 
85 Soon, the baby swan grows up. It becomes very beautiful. go away 走开 grey 灰色的 grow up 长大 neck 脖子 swan 天鹅 Word List

85 Soon, the baby swan grows up. It becomes very beautiful. go away 走开 grey 灰色的 grow up 长大 neck 脖子 swan 天鹅 Word List 
86 There are lots of different spiders. There are big ones and small ones, fat ones and thin ones. Some are brown, some are black, some are orange and some are red. Spiders live in webs in houses and schools. They also live in parks and streets. Spiders Spiders 
87 Look at the pictures. How many legs has a spider got? Spiders eat insects. They make webs. If insects get in the webs, they cannot get out. Then the spiders eat them. Are there any webs in your classroom? Some spiders can hurt you. Some cannot. Do you like spiders? Or are you scared of them? spider 蜘蛛 web 网 Word List

content:
88 And we like the Dragon Boat Festival. OK. Very good. Great! Our favourite festival is the Spring Festival. the Mid-Autumn Festival the Lantern Festival 1. Work in groups. Choose different Chinese festivals. the Spring Festival the Dragon Boat Festival Make a Festival Poster We want to find out about the Lantern Festival. 
89 2. Find information about your festival. When is the festival? What do people do? What do they eat and drink? Why do they have the festival? 
90 Draw some pictures and write some sentences. The Lantern Festival is in spring. People put lanterns in the streets. The lanterns are very beautiful. In Northeast China, people make lanterns from ice! 3. Write about the festival. 
91 4. Now talk to the class about the festival. The Lantern Festival is in spring. People eat yuanxiao at the Lantern Festival.

content: 既名为“后记”，一般应该是本教材使用完毕后才看到的吧。 那么，同学们，你们喜欢这套教材吗？大明、玲玲以及他们的小伙伴们是否让你们喜爱上了英语，并且帮助你们掌握了一定的英语运用能力呢？如果是这样，那就太好啦！希望你们在以后的英语学习中继续大胆地开口说英语——课上说、课下说；继续积极地参与各项语言活动。 一句话，你们要尽量主动使用英语来表达意思和做事情，这样才能把英语学好。 可敬的老师们，感谢你们的辛勤劳动，以及你们为国家英语课程改革付出的努力和做出的贡献。在修订本套教材的过程中，我们也充分考虑了英语课程改革以及一线教学的需求。修订后的教材更加突出了英语课程工具性和人文性的统一，优化了各册的结构设计和内容安排，以使教学脉络更加清晰、梯度更加合理。 为了在最大程度上保证教材与课程标准的契合，便于一线教学使用， 所有参与本套教材编写的人员均付出了艰辛的努力。在此我想特别感谢我的编写团队，没有他们的努力与付出，就没有本教材的问世。 本册教材的主要编写人员如下（中方编写人员按姓氏笔画排序）： Naomi Simmons （英） 于业宏王馨悦孙 泓张 琦樊 波你 们的 二 〇 一二年春日义务教育教科书 （一年级起点） 六年级上册
